Art. 4.226. 
Use of cash 
Within a period of six months from the date of the closure of the inventory, the encumbered party shall make use of the cash, the money deriving from the price of the movables which have been sold, and of what has been received from the active effects.
This period may be extended, if necessary.
The encumbered party is likewise obliged to use the cash arising from recovered debts and repayments of annuities within three months of receipt of the cash. 
This application is made in accordance with the order of the author of the disposition, if he has designated the nature of the assets in which the application is to be made; otherwise, it can only be made in immovables, or with a lien on immovables.
 The application ordered by paragraphs 1 to 3 is made in the presence and at the behest of the tutor appointed for the purpose.
